The claim originated from a post on the: which stated that quoting the Bible would become illegal in Cincinnati as of 9 December 2015.
The post cited Cincinnati: com as a source, linking to an article titled "Cincinnati to consider ban on reparative therapy for LGBT youth." This article had no mention of making it illegal to quote from the Bible.
The article mentioned that City Council: imposing a $200-a-day fine on therapists or counselors practicing such therapy.
The claim misinterpreted the proposed ba: leading to a false assertion of Cincinnati making it illegal to quote from the Bible.
